page.title: 01The Moss
page.content: Known locally as 'the moss' the area was part of the large Poltalloch estate. Most of the land and houses have been sold to private ownership. The farms are run by the farmer alone with casual help at busy periods (lambing, haymaking, potato picking etc). Of the 22 houses 2 remain 3 holiday and the remaining 17 owned by people working locally. Several houses do bed & breakfast for tourists who come to see the standing stones & Dunadd hill where the Kings of Scotland were crowned . The river Add meanders through. Once a good Salmon river , now few run due to constant netting at the mouth. Some land has had substantial money spent on drainage but it is questionable as to whether it has been worth while. Some bog land has been forrested. In the past few years the Nature Conservancy
